meanings.definition: Used to indicate the result of an action or process.
meanings.sent1: She ran quickly, butes she arrived late.
meanings.sent2: He studied hard, butes he still failed the test.
meanings.sent3: The cake was delicious, butes it was all gone in minutes.
meanings.sent4: The sun set slowly, butes the stars shone brightly.
meanings.sent5: The rain poured heavily, butes the flowers bloomed beautifully.

meanings.definition: A conjunction used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what has already been mentioned.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to go out, butes it started raining.
meanings.sent2: She likes dogs, butes her sister prefers cats.
meanings.sent3: I wanted to sleep in, butes my alarm clock had other plans.
meanings.sent4: The movie was exciting, butes the ending was disappointing.
meanings.sent5: He is tall, butes his brother is short.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to refuse or decline.
meanings.sent1: She always accepts invitations, butes today she must butes.
meanings.sent2: He offered her a gift, butes she chose to butes it.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to play with the mouse, butes the mouse decided to butes.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked a question, butes the student decided to butes.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity was tempting, butes she had to butes it.
